definitions.definition: A noisy crackling sound; the sound usually associated with crunching.
A problem that leads to a crisis.
(exercise) A form of abdominal exercise, based on a sit-up but in which the lower back remains in contact with the floor.
The overtime work required to catch up and finish a project, usually in the final weeks of development before release.
A dessert consisting of a crunchy topping with fruit underneath.
(generally in the plural) A small piece created by crushing; a piece of material with a friable or crunchy texture.
To crush something, especially food, with a noisy crackling sound.
definitions.example: When I came home, Susan was watching TV with her feet up on the couch, crunching a piece of celery.

definitions.definition: To be crushed with a noisy crackling sound.
definitions.example: Beetles crunched beneath the men's heavy boots as they worked.

definitions.definition: To calculate or otherwise process (e.g. to crunch numbers: to perform mathematical calculations). Presumably from the sound made by mechanical calculators.
definitions.example: That metadata makes it much easier for the search engine to crunch the data for queries.

definitions.definition: To grind or press with violence and noise.
To emit a grinding or crunching noise.
To compress (data) using a particular algorithm, so that it can be restored by decrunching.
To make employees work overtime in order to meet a deadline in the development of a project.
